name: Renaissance Washington, DC Dupont Circle Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a wedding in Washington over Cherry Blossom weekend. The hotel was very busy but the staff handled it all with ease. The hotel's lobby was great and much nice than the Marriott around the block. The room was small, but well furnished. I loved the walk in shower. I always appreciate it when you can actually get HD content on the HDTV they have in the room (you'd be amazing how little this is the case). Location was great. Close to Foggy Bottom & Dupont Metro stations. The neighborhood is one of the best in DC.
reviews.title: Great Location and Value!

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel for the Cherry Blossom Festival. The hotel as well as the room was very clean. Check in/out was efficient. The housekeeping staff was very nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in DC

reviews.text: White house is a nice 20min walk from hotel and the DuPont neighborhood is a great choice for shopping and meals...definitely recommend this hotel and hope to stay here again in July on repeat visit!
reviews.title: nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked on priceline for $88 a night. We got three rooms for a family event. We were traveling with a small baby, so after reading on TripAdvisor that the rooms were small, we called ahead and asked for a bigger room. They upgraded two of the rooms, and even provided two small, empty refridgerators free of charge. However, we couldnt fit our pack n play (crib) in the room, we ended up setting it up in the bathroom. The location was the best I've ever stayed in Washington, we could walk to the Mall in about 15 minutes, or take the metro. The conceirge was really helpful, provided us with maps and advice. It was a nice, quiet, clean hotel and I couldnt ask for anything more at that price.
reviews.title: Stay here!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in love with this place from first sight of our room! We had one queen bed so the room was not small even though its location cut our some space. Great flat screen TV, great reception, quiet room, soaps etc excellent. Coffee pot made individual cups, very good but with Illy in the lobby we looked forward to that every morning. Beds were comfortable with extra down pillows immediately brought on request. Room temperature perfect. Staff were friendly yet respected privacy. Concierge was very helpful. The room had obviously been remodeled fairly recently and had a modern yet soothing decor. Finally, it was only 4-5 blocks from the blue line and 4-5 from the red line subways. I have no complaints and am very happy we chose this over the Latham which would have ment quite a walk to the subway. (no small difference in the rain).
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed this hotel...But, we paid $75/night through priceline. If we had paid the rack rate, i would have been upset. The hotel is nice, in a fairly good location--not too far from the dupont circle subway. Staff were friendly. Overall, it was a good experience.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - But not for full price

reviews.text: The concierge and desk staff were "at the ready" at all times, and VERY receptive and responsive to all of our questions. Rooms were a bit small, but efficient and comfortable. They were cleaned to spotless daily while we were out. Room service was a little slow, but they were good about it. All in all, I would stay there again anytime!
reviews.title: Excellent Service, made us feel welcome!

reviews.text: The hotel was very modern and clean, the room was a good size (i had the option of 1 or 2 double beds in the room) with all the amenities needed - safe which a laptop fit into, tea/coffee, TV, hairdryer etc.
reviews.title: fantastic!!! beautiful hotel, friendly staff

reviews.text: The breakfast was about $16 which i thought was quite expensive (as was the coffee bar)- but the staff were happy to help suggest places close by (bread and chocolate a bakery) which was great.
reviews.title: Small rooms, great location

reviews.text: The staff here really were fantastic, from helping plan my sightseeing to storing luggage until i left - noting was too much trouble. I paid $119 per night in advance through their website and feel this was an absolute bargain!! The hotel is a definite 4* and only 5 minutes to the metro which was very easy to use.
reviews.title: Good choice if you don't pay full price

reviews.text: Stayed here two nights. Our admin got the rooms at $120 per night. The hotel was pretty quiet, and service was good. HDTV was a nice plus. However, the room is so small that the cleverly pivoting desk was still a pain to walk around, given that you have to move the chair to get to the closet. Motel 6's have bigger rooms! High-speed internet is now $13/day. This was the smallest hotel room I'd ever seen in the US. Also had breakfast both mornings in the hotel. As expected for a big city hotel restaurant, breakfast is massively overpriced ($14 for ham & eggs), although the "green eggs and ham" was a dish both novel and tasty.
reviews.title: Tight quarters - good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is modern, upscale and good value. You can walk (20 mins) to the awesome Georgetown area for dinner in one of the many many great restaurants there (loved Georgetown). The staff were friendly and helpful and looked after us well. The hotel was super busy when we checked in with a convention or something starting downstairs, but the staff were helpful and not overwhelmed. The room was modern (stylish with flat panel TV etc) and clean but pretty small. A staff member went out of their way to get me a bottle opener from the kitchen. Minor complaints: When checking out, the generally not that friendly valet staff were swamped with cars as there were many people waiting. When I pay $30 for overnight parking I don't want to wait 20 minutes in the freezing rain for my car to come out of the garage.
reviews.title: High quality modern hotel, good location, small room

reviews.text: My experience at the hotel was great, but my experience after check out, being double-billed for the room and trying to obtain a refund from the hotel, was abysmal.
reviews.title: Check your credit card bill!

reviews.text: I booked and prepaid the room with Priceline. On check in I was told the room was pre-paid but was asked to give a credit card for incidentals. I found out a week later when I checked my bill that I had been charged by the hotel not for incidentals but for the room I had already paid for through Priceline. It took four different phone calls and about 25 minutes on hold with various people to finally get this resolved. The first person I called promised to resolve it but didn't do anything. When I called to follow up the people at the front desk who initally fielded the call were rude and unhelpful. Finally the one hopefully competent person there seems to have gotten it resolved, but given the hotel's overall incompetence I'll believe it when I see it.
reviews.title: Worked out perfect

reviews.text: If you don't have these billing problems, then the place is great. Very nicely done, recently renovated rooms, excellent location, nice Illy cafe adjoining the lobby. Only downsides are rooms are pretty small, if well-designed, and there is no pool.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.text: We got a room for $75 from Priceline.com The room was great, we like it very much. The hotel has very expensive wallet parking ($35!). Rooms are very small! Don't go to this hotel with children!
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Convenient
reviews.text: Found the location very convenient - in walking distance to Dupont Circle - but quieter than other Dupont Circle hotels that I have stayed at (one time I stayed at a great hotel but it was right next door to a late night tatoo parlor...). Rooms are small as mentioned in previous posts but fine for my needs. Staff very helpful.
A surprising hotel a bit off the beaten path. Not a great location for sightseeing, but pretty good for business. A solid 25 minute walk to the mall by the Lincoln Memorial.
reviews.title: Cool elegance

reviews.text: The hotel is very stylish with a european feel, including many travelers from around the world judging from the languages at the bar. As other reviews stated, the rooms quite nice. The are small, fine for couples or business, but tight for our family of five. The rollout left zero walking space to get around the room.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good value if you can get a special or deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was not eventful one way or the other.
reviews.title: Not the greatest stay

description: Sophisticated and contemporary, our hotel's accommodations exude stylish luxury. Perfect for a getaway to the Washington, DC area, our hotel is minutes from Georgetown, Foggy Bottom and the DC Metro, bringing the best of the city's attractions to our doorstep. Our guest rooms and suites feature deluxe amenities creating the boutique hotel experience our guests have come to expect. Take in our goose down bedding, sleek bathrooms, wireless Internet and plug-in technology panels, all the while exploring our unique location in the nation's capital. Sip and savor in our Caffe serving illy coffee and our M Lounge & M Brasserie serving indigenous, seasonal dishes and cocktails. An on-site fitness center and business center ensure you are taken care of while on your road and don't forget to ask our Navigator for insider tips for dining and shopping in the city.
